comments:
3.3M6 I20070323-1616

Two public classes in one file:

// X.java
public class X{}
public class Y{}
// End X.java

Invoke the Quick Fix "Rename compilation unit to 'Y.java'" on the class Y declaration:

  1) This also renames class X to Y (now two declarations of class Y).  
  2) Undo doesn't undo but marks editor as dirty.
  3) Renaming the CU back to X in Package Explorer (without first saving)
     reports an unexpected Refactoring exception "Illegal value: -1".
     (Error log traces 1, 2, below)
  4) Giving the editor focus reports that the file on disk has changed.
     Click yes to load the "changes".
  5) Renaming the CU back to X will now complete normally (resulting in
     two declaraions of class X).



In the below o.e.c.i corresponds to org.eclipse.core.internal.

fixed > 20070416
The fix only enables the quick fix on the first public type found

The stack trace comes from the problem described in bug 186153.

For the rename CU quick fixes, I don't want to try to fix all possible corner cases, but rather limit to most common ones.
The (new) fix makes sure that:
- don't suggest to rename if there's already a type with that name in the file
- only suggest rename for the first public type
